column4: Visual effects stopped working for me after I upgraded to 8.10 even though it's worked in 8.04
you mean Compiz?
I think so, it comes default with 8.10 right?
yeah, it's compiz.  It's worked in 8.04
you should be able to get it in the Add/Remove under Applications.
it's there, but when I try to enable it, it just thinks that my card can't handle it
what card
it's an intel card
which intel card?
Intel Mobile 945GM/GMS/940GML Express Integrated Graphics Controller
could have something to do with your resolution. what is that set at?
I'm sure it's not because of a non-supported driver. This is a Dell Ubuntu laptop and it works fine if I use the live CD
right now it's 1280x800
let me look around for a bit
are you using an attached monitor?
no, I'm using a laptop.
this new version allows me to also output to TV if I connect the S-video port
ok
everything I am finding points to a possible driver bug, but I don't have much more detail than that. Still looking...
any luck?
not yet, everything has been coming to a dead end
most of the linked bugs I am finding seem to point to driver issues, but when I start heading that way the related bugs are due to some external monitor
I think it's some botched configuration, since it works fine in the LiveCD
I really think so too
